sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of traffic accident occurring on a road
message_1:
Here's a precise numerical problem related to the subtopic "Probability of a certain type of traffic accident occurring on a road": 

A busy intersection has an average of 20 accidents per month. Among these accidents, 60% are rear-end collisions. What is the probability that the next accident at the intersection will be a rear-end collision?
message_2: The probability that the next accident at the intersection will be a rear-end collision is 60%. This is because the historical data shows that 60% of the accidents at this intersection are rear-end collisions, and we can assume that this trend will continue in the future.
